analyzed: 'dus byas zhes bya ba'am /

analyzed: 'dus ma byas zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //

analyzed: skye ba zhes bya ba'am /
translated: or anything that could be called uncompounded.

analyzed: mi skye ba zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: They do not see anything that could be called arising,

analyzed: 'gag ces bya ba'am /
translated: or anything that could be called ceasing.

original: mi 'gag ces bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //🔽dben zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: mi 'gag ces bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo // dben zhes bya ba'am /
translated: He does not consider that it is not obstructed.🔽He does not consider that it is isolated.

original: mi dben zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //🔽dge ba zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: mi dben zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo // dge ba zhes bya ba'am /
translated: He does not consider that it is not isolated.🔽He does not consider that it is virtuous.

original: mi dge ba zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //🔽kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: mi dge ba zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo // kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa zhes bya ba'am /
translated: He does not consider that it is non-virtuous.

original: kha na ma tho ba med pa zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //🔽zag pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba med pa zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo // zag pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba'am /
translated: He does not consider that it is reprehensible.

original: zag pa med pa zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: zag pa med pa zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: He does not consider that it is irreproachable.

original: nyon mongs pa dang bcas @105a * //🔽pa zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang bcas @105a * // pa zhes bya ba'am /
translated: He does not consider that it is subject to affliction.

original: nyon mongs pa med pa zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //🔽'jig rten pa zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo // 'jig rten pa zhes bya ba'am /
translated: He does not consider that it is free from affliction.🔽He does not consider that it is mundane.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //🔽kun nas nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //🔽kun nas nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba'am /
translated: He does not consider that it is supramundane.🔽He does not consider that it is contaminated.

original: rnam par byang ba zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: He does not see purification.

original: lce dang / ro dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa'i reg pa'i rkyen gyis byung ba'i tshor ba bde ba'am /🔽sdug bsngal ba'am /
analyzed: lce dang / ro dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa'i reg pa'i rkyen gyis byung ba'i tshor ba bde ba'am / sdug bsngal ba'am /
translated: “The feeling that arises from the condition of the contact of the tongue and tastes and tongue consciousness is neither a self nor not a self.

original: bde ba yang ma yin /
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin /
translated: He does not see it as happiness or suffering.🔽He does not see it as a self or not a self.🔽He does not see it as empty or not empty.🔽He does not see it as having aspirations or not having aspirations.

original: sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa gang yin pa de 'khor ba zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa gang yin pa de 'khor ba zhes bya ba'am /
translated: He does not see it as calm or not calm.🔽He does not see it as having an intrinsic nature or not having an intrinsic nature.🔽He does not see it as bound or freed.🔽He does not see it as arising or ceasing.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: He does not see it as afflicted or purified.

original: lus dang / reg bya dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i reg pa'i rkyen gyis byung ba'i tshor ba bde ba'am /🔽sdug bsngal ba'am /
analyzed: lus dang / reg bya dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i reg pa'i rkyen gyis byung ba'i tshor ba bde ba'am / sdug bsngal ba'am /
translated: “The feeling that arises from the condition of the contact of the body and physical objects and body consciousness is neither a self nor not a self.

original: bde ba yang ma yin /🔽sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa gang yin pa de yang rtag ces bya ba'am /
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin / sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa gang yin pa de yang rtag ces bya ba'am /
translated: He does not see it as happiness or suffering.🔽He does not see it as a self or not a self.🔽He does not see it as empty or not empty.

original: mi rtag ces bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //🔽de bzhin du bde zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: mi rtag ces bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //🔽de bzhin du bde zhes bya ba'am /
translated: He does not see it as having aspirations or not having aspirations.🔽He does not see it as calm or not calm.

analyzed: sdug bsngal zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo // bdag ces bya ba'am /

analyzed: 'dus ma byas zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo // skye ba zhes bya ba'am /

translated: He does not see it as samsara or nirvana.

original: sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa gang yin pa de 'khor ba zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa gang yin pa de 'khor ba zhes bya ba'am /
translated: He does not see the contact of the mental faculty, mental phenomena, and mental consciousness, or the pleasant, unpleasant, or neither unpleasant nor pleasant feeling that arises from the condition of that contact, as samsara or nirvana.🔽He does not see it as samsara or nirvana.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
translated: This is the receptivity to the cognition of the origin of suffering.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: “Why is that?”🔽Because, Śāriputra, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom, they do not see the perfection of wisdom, nor do they see a bodhisattva or the name of a bodhisattva.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ming de 'dus byas kyi khams sam /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ming de 'dus byas kyi khams sam /
translated: They do not see the perfection of concentration,

original: 'dus ma byas kyi khams su yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi khams su yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: He does not see the compounded element, nor does he see the uncompounded element.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: rab 'byor 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na chos de dag thams cad la mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go //🔽de rnam par mi rtog pa'i chos la gnas nas dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams sgom par byed cing shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la bya ba ma gtogs par shes rab kyi pha
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na chos de dag thams cad la mi rtog rnam par mi rtog go // de rnam par mi rtog pa'i chos la gnas nas dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams sgom par byed cing shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la bya ba ma gtogs par shes rab kyi pha
translated: Subhūti, it is because the bodhisattva great being practicing the perfection of wisdom does not conceptualize or falsely project any of those dharmas.

original: rol tu phyin pa nyid kyang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: rol tu phyin pa nyid kyang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: Abiding in the dharma of non-conceptualization, he cultivates the applications of mindfulness. When he practices the perfection of wisdom, except for the attention on omniscience, he does not see even the perfection of wisdom itself.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: He does not see even the name ‘perfection of wisdom.’

original: byang chub sems dpa' yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: He does not see even the bodhisattva.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i ming yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i ming yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: He does not see even the name ‘bodhisattva.’

original: de bzhin du yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam dang / pha rol tu @106b phyin pa rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam dang / pha rol tu @106b phyin pa rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams dang /
translated: Similarly, he cultivates the right efforts, legs of miraculous power, faculties, powers, limbs of awakening, path, perfections, and the powers of the tathāgatas,

original: mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad sgom par byed cing shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad sgom par byed cing shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: fearlessnesses, detailed and thorough knowledges, and eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha. When he cultivates the perfection of wisdom and practices the perfection of wisdom, he does not see even the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: He does not see even the name ‘perfection of wisdom.’

original: byang chub sems dpa' yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: He does not see even the name ‘bodhisattva.’

original: byang chub sems dpa'i ming yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i ming yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'o //
translated: This is subsequent knowledge in relation to suffering.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa des ni chos rnams kyi chos kyi mtshan nyid shin tu rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa des ni chos rnams kyi chos kyi mtshan nyid shin tu rtogs pa yin te /
translated: “Because that bodhisattva great being has fully understood the intrinsic identity of dharmas.”

original: chos rnams kyi chos kyi mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi chos kyi mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur /
translated: The intrinsic identity of dharmas is not defiled

original: rnam par byang bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: rnam par byang bar mi 'gyur /
translated: and is not purified.🔽Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom like that should fully understand that all dharmas are just names, just designations.”

original: rab 'byor de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas ming gi brda dang ldan pa'i chos rnams rtag par khong du chud par bya'o zhes bya ba ni kun 'byung la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas ming gi brda dang ldan pa'i chos rnams rtag par khong du chud par bya'o zhes bya ba ni kun 'byung la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
translated: This is Dharma knowledge in relation to the origin.

original: des ming gi brda dang ldan pa'i chos su btags par khong du chud pas gzugs la chags pa med do //
analyzed: des ming gi brda dang ldan pa'i chos su btags par khong du chud pas gzugs la chags pa med do //
translated: He understands the designation of phenomena that are endowed with names. He is not attached to form.

original: tshor ba la chags pa med do //
analyzed: tshor ba la chags pa med do //
translated: He is not attached to feeling.

original: 'du shes la chags pa med do //
analyzed: 'du shes la chags pa med do //
translated: He is not attached to perception.

original: 'du byed rnams la chags pa med do //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams la chags pa med do //
translated: He is not attached to volitional factors.

original: rnam par shes pa la chags pa med do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la chags pa med do //
translated: He is not attached to consciousness.

original: mig la mngon par chags pa med do //
analyzed: mig la mngon par chags pa med do //
translated: He is not attached to the eyes.

original: gzugs la mngon par chags pa med do //
analyzed: gzugs la mngon par chags pa med do //
translated: He is not attached to form.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa la mngon par chags pa med do //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa la mngon par chags pa med do //
translated: He is not attached to eye consciousness.

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa la mngon par chags pa med do //🔽mig dang gzugs dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen las skyes pa'i tshor ba bde ba'am /🔽sdug bsngal ba'am /
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa la mngon par chags pa med do // mig dang gzugs dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen las skyes pa'i tshor ba bde ba'am / sdug bsngal ba'am /
translated: He is not attached to eye contact.

original: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa gang yin pa de la yang mngon par chags pa med do //
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa gang yin pa de la yang mngon par chags pa med do //
translated: He is not attached to the feeling that arises from the condition of eye contact with form, whether pleasant, painful, or neither painful nor pleasant.

original: rna ba la mngon par chags pa med do //
analyzed: rna ba la mngon par chags pa med do //
translated: He is not attached to the ears.

original: sgra la mngon par chags pa med do //
analyzed: sgra la mngon par chags pa med do //
translated: He is not attached to sound.

original: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa la mngon par chags pa med do //
analyzed: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa la mngon par chags pa med do //
translated: He is not attached to the ear consciousness.

original: rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa la mngon par chags pa med do //🔽rna ba dang sgra dang / rna ba'i rnam par @107a * //
analyzed: rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa la mngon par chags pa med do // rna ba dang sgra dang / rna ba'i rnam par @107a * //
translated: He is not attached to the contact that arises from the combination of the three—ear, sound, and ear consciousness.

original: shes pa 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen las skyes pa'i tshor ba bde ba'am /
analyzed: shes pa 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen las skyes pa'i tshor ba bde ba'am /
translated: He is not attached to the pleasant, unpleasant, or neither pleasant nor unpleasant feeling that arises from the condition of the contact that arises from the combination of the ear, sound, and ear consciousness.🔽He is not attached to the nose.

original: sdug bsngal ba'am /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba'am /
translated: He is not attached to smell.🔽He is not attached to the nose consciousness.🔽He is not attached to the contact that arises from the combination of the three—nose, smell, and nose consciousness.

original: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa gang yin pa de la yang mngon par chags pa med do //
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa gang yin pa de la yang mngon par chags pa med do //
translated: He is not attached to the pleasant, unpleasant, or neither pleasant nor unpleasant feeling that arises from the condition of the contact that arises from the combination of the nose, smell, and nose consciousness.

original: sna la mngon par chags pa med do //🔽dril mngon par chags pa med do //
analyzed: sna la mngon par chags pa med do // dril mngon par chags pa med do //
translated: He is not attached to the tongue.🔽He is not attached to taste.🔽He is not attached to the tongue consciousness.

original: sna'i rnam par shes pa la mngon par chags pa med do //
analyzed: sna'i rnam par shes pa la mngon par chags pa med do //
translated: He is not attached to the contact that arises from the combination of the three—tongue, taste, and tongue consciousness.🔽He is not attached to the pleasant, unpleasant, or neither pleasant nor unpleasant feeling that arises from the condition of the contact that arises from the combination of the tongue, taste, and tongue consciousness.🔽He is not attached to the body.

original: sna'i 'dus te reg pa la mngon par chags pa med do //🔽sna dang dri dang sna'i rnam par shes pa 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen las skyes pa'i tshor ba bde ba'am /
analyzed: sna'i 'dus te reg pa la mngon par chags pa med do // sna dang dri dang sna'i rnam par shes pa 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen las skyes pa'i tshor ba bde ba'am /
translated: He is not attached to touch.🔽He is not attached to the body consciousness.🔽He is not attached to the contact that arises from the combination of the three—body, touch, and body consciousness.

original: sdug bsngal ba'am /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba'am /
translated: He is not attached to the pleasant, unpleasant, or neither pleasant nor unpleasant feeling that arises from the condition of the contact that arises from the combination of the body, touch, and body consciousness.🔽He is not attached to the mind.🔽He is not attached to phenomena.

original: bde ba yang ma yin /
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin /
translated: He is not attached to the mind consciousness.🔽He is not attached to the contact that arises from the combination of the three—mind, phenomena, and mind consciousness.🔽He is not attached to the pleasant, unpleasant, or neither pleasant nor unpleasant feeling that arises from the condition of the contact that arises from the combination of the mind, phenomena, and mind consciousness.

original: sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa gang yin pa de la yang mngon par chags pa med do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa gang yin pa de la yang mngon par chags pa med do //
translated: He has no attachment to what is neither pleasant nor unpleasant.

original: lce la mngon par chags pa med do //
analyzed: lce la mngon par chags pa med do //
translated: He has no attachment to the tongue.

original: ro la mngon par chags pa med do //
analyzed: ro la mngon par chags pa med do //
translated: He has no attachment to tastes.

original: lce'i rnam par shes pa la mngon par chags pa med do //
analyzed: lce'i rnam par shes pa la mngon par chags pa med do //
translated: He has no attachment to the tongue consciousness.

original: lce'i 'dus te reg pa la mngon par chags pa med do //🔽lce dang / ro dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen las skyes pa'i tshor ba bde ba'am /🔽sdug bsngal ba'am /🔽bde ba yang ma yin /
analyzed: lce'i 'dus te reg pa la mngon par chags pa med do // lce dang / ro dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen las skyes pa'i tshor ba bde ba'am / sdug bsngal ba'am / bde ba yang ma yin /
translated: He has no attachment to the contact that arises from the combination of the three—tongue, taste, and tongue consciousness.

original: sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa gang yin pa de la yang mngon par chags pa med do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa gang yin pa de la yang mngon par chags pa med do //
translated: He has no attachment to the pleasant, unpleasant, or neither pleasant nor unpleasant feeling that arises from the condition of the contact that arises from the combination of the three—tongue, taste, and tongue consciousness.

original: lus la mngon par chags pa med do //
analyzed: lus la mngon par chags pa med do //
translated: He has no attachment to the body.

original: reg bya la mngon par chags pa med do //🔽lus kyi rnam par shes pa la mngon par chags pa med do //
analyzed: reg bya la mngon par chags pa med do // lus kyi rnam par shes pa la mngon par chags pa med do //
translated: He has no attachment to tactile objects.🔽He has no attachment to the body consciousness.

original: lus kyi 'dus te reg pa la mngon par chags pa med do //
analyzed: lus kyi 'dus te reg pa la mngon par chags pa med do //
translated: He has no attachment to the contact that arises from the combination of the three—body, tactile objects, and body consciousness.

original: lus dang reg bya dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen las skyes pa'i tshor ba bde ba'am /🔽sdug bsngal ba'am /🔽bde ba yang ma yin /🔽sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa gang yin pa de la yang mngon par chags pa med do //
analyzed: lus dang reg bya dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen las skyes pa'i tshor ba bde ba'am / sdug bsngal ba'am / bde ba yang ma yin / sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa gang yin pa de la yang mngon par chags pa med do //
translated: He is not attached to the body, to tangibles, or to the body-consciousness. He is not attached to the contact that arises from the union of these three, nor to the pleasant, unpleasant, or neither unpleasant nor pleasant feeling that contact causes.

original: yid la mngon par chags pa med do //
analyzed: yid la mngon par chags pa med do //
translated: He is not attached to the mind, to mental phenomena, or to mind-consciousness.🔽He is not attached to the contact that arises from the union of these three, nor to the pleasant, unpleasant, or neither unpleasant nor pleasant feeling that contact causes.

original: chos la mngon par chags pa med do //
analyzed: chos la mngon par chags pa med do //
translated: He is not attached to the compounded element.🔽He is not attached to the uncompounded element.🔽He is not attached to the element of space.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa la mngon par chags pa med do //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa la mngon par chags pa med do //
translated: He is not attached to the element of consciousness.🔽He is not attached to the element of the absence of attributes.🔽He is not attached to the element of the absence of desire.

original: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa la mngon par chags pa med do //
analyzed: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa la mngon par chags pa med do //
translated: He is not attached to the element of cessation.🔽He is not attached to the element of the absence of attributes.🔽He is not attached to the element of the absence of desire.🔽He is not attached to the element of cessation.

original: yid dang chos dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen las skyes pa'i tshor ba bde ba'am /
analyzed: yid dang chos dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen las skyes pa'i tshor ba bde ba'am /
translated: He is not attached to the element of the absence of desire.🔽He is not attached to the element of cessation.🔽He is not attached to the element of the absence of desire.🔽He is not attached to the element of cessation.🔽He is not attached to the element of the absence of desire.🔽He is not attached to the element of cessation.🔽He is not attached to the element of the absence of desire.🔽He is not attached to the element of cessation.🔽He is not attached to the element of the absence of desire.🔽He is not attached to the element of cessation.🔽He is not attached to the element of the absence of desire.🔽He is not attached to the element of cessation.🔽He is not attached to the element of the absence of desire.🔽He is not attached to the element of cessation.🔽He is not attached to the element of the absence of desire.

original: sdug bsngal ba'am /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba'am /
translated: He is not attached to the element of cessation.🔽He is not attached to the element of the absence of desire.🔽He is not attached to the element of cessation.

original: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa gang yin pa de la yang mngon par chags pa med do //
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa gang yin pa de la yang mngon par chags pa med do //
translated: He is not attached to the element of the absence of desire.

original: 'dus @107b byas kyi khams la mngon par chags pa med do //
analyzed: 'dus @107b byas kyi khams la mngon par chags pa med do //
translated: He is not attached to the element of cessation.🔽He is not attached to the element of the absence of desire.🔽He is not attached to the element of cessation.🔽He is not attached to the element of the

original: 'dus ma byas kyi khams la mngon par chags pa med do zhes bya ba ni kun 'byung la chos shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi khams la mngon par chags pa med do zhes bya ba ni kun 'byung la chos shes pa'o //
translated: He does not settle down on the uncompounded element. This is the knowledge of the Truth of Origination.

original: de sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la mngon par chags pa med do //
analyzed: de sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la mngon par chags pa med do //
translated: He does not settle down on the perfection of giving.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mngon par chags pa med do //🔽bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la mngon par chags pa med do //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mngon par chags pa med do // bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la mngon par chags pa med do //
translated: He does not settle down on the perfection of morality.🔽He does not settle down on the perfection of patience.

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mngon par chags pa med do //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mngon par chags pa med do //
translated: He does not settle down on the perfection of vigour.

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mngon par chags pa med do //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mngon par chags pa med do //
translated: He does not settle down on the perfection of meditation.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mngon par chags pa med do /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mngon par chags pa med do /
translated: He does not settle down on the perfection of wisdom.

original: de dag ni ming dang mtshan nyid la yang mngon par chags pa med do //
analyzed: de dag ni ming dang mtshan nyid la yang mngon par chags pa med do //
translated: He does not settle down on names and characteristics.

original: lus la mngon par chags pa med do //
analyzed: lus la mngon par chags pa med do //
translated: He does not settle down on the body.

original: sha'i mig la mngon par chags pa med do //
analyzed: sha'i mig la mngon par chags pa med do //
translated: He does not settle down on the fleshly eye.

original: lha'i mig la mngon par chags pa med do //
analyzed: lha'i mig la mngon par chags pa med do //
translated: He does not settle down on the divine eye.

original: shes rab kyi mig la mngon par chags pa med do //
analyzed: shes rab kyi mig la mngon par chags pa med do //
translated: He is not attached to the eye of wisdom.

original: chos kyi mig la mngon par chags pa med do //
analyzed: chos kyi mig la mngon par chags pa med do //
translated: He is not attached to the eye of Dharma.

original: sangs rgyas kyi mig la mngon par chags pa med do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi mig la mngon par chags pa med do //
translated: He is not attached to the eye of a buddha.

original: mngon par shes pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la mngon par chags pa med do //🔽nang stong pa nyid la mngon par chags pa med do //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la mngon par chags pa med do // nang stong pa nyid la mngon par chags pa med do //
translated: He is not attached to the perfections of supernormal knowledge.🔽He is not attached to inner emptiness.

original: phyi stong pa nyid la mngon par chags pa med do //
analyzed: phyi stong pa nyid la mngon par chags pa med do //
translated: He is not attached to outer emptiness.

original: phyi nang stong pa nyid la mngon par chags pa med do //
analyzed: phyi nang stong pa nyid la mngon par chags pa med do //
translated: He is not attached to inner and outer emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid stong pa nyid la mngon par chags pa med do //
analyzed: stong pa nyid stong pa nyid la mngon par chags pa med do //
translated: He is not attached to the emptiness of emptiness.

original: chen po stong pa nyid dang / don dam pa stong pa nyid dang / 'dus byas stong pa nyid dang / 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid dang / mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: chen po stong pa nyid dang / don dam pa stong pa nyid dang / 'dus byas stong pa nyid dang / 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid dang / mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid dang /
translated: He is not attached to great emptiness, ultimate emptiness, the emptiness of conditioned phenomena, the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, the emptiness of what is beyond extremes, the emptiness of beginning and end,

original: dor ba med pa stong pa nyid dang / rang bzhin stong pa nyid dang / chos thams cad stong pa nyid dang / rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid dang / mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: dor ba med pa stong pa nyid dang / rang bzhin stong pa nyid dang / chos thams cad stong pa nyid dang / rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid dang / mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa stong pa nyid dang /
translated: emptiness of non-rejection, emptiness of intrinsic nature, emptiness of all phenomena, emptiness of specific characteristics, emptiness of non-apprehension, emptiness of non-entities,

original: ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dang / rang gi dngos po stong pa nyid dang / gzhan gyi dngos po stong pa nyid la mngon par chags pa med do //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dang / rang gi dngos po stong pa nyid dang / gzhan gyi dngos po stong pa nyid la mngon par chags pa med do //
translated: emptiness of essential nature, emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities, emptiness of one's own entity, and emptiness of another's entity.

original: de bzhin nyid la mngon par chags pa med do //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la mngon par chags pa med do //
translated: They are not attached to suchness.

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' la mngon par chags pa med do //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' la mngon par chags pa med do //
translated: They are not attached to the limit of reality.

original: chos kyi dbyings la mngon par chags pa @108a * //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings la mngon par chags pa @108a * //
translated: They are not attached to the dharma-realm.

original: med do // sems can yongs su smin par bya ba la mngon par chags pa med do //
analyzed: med do // sems can yongs su smin par bya ba la mngon par chags pa med do //
translated: They are not attached to bringing sentient beings to maturity.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba la mngon par chags pa med do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba la mngon par chags pa med do //
translated: They are not attached to purifying a buddha-field.

original: thabs la mkhas pa la mngon par chags pa med do //
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa la mngon par chags pa med do //
translated: He is not attached to skill in means.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽'di ltar gang chags par byed pa'am /🔽gang gis chags par bya ba'am /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / 'di ltar gang chags par byed pa'am / gang gis chags par bya ba'am /
translated: And why?🔽Because all those dharmas which would be attached to,🔽by which one would be attached,

original: gang la chags par bya ba de lta bu'i chos thams cad med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: gang la chags par bya ba de lta bu'i chos thams cad med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
translated: or on which one would be attached, do not exist.

original: rab 'byor de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing chos thams cad la mngon par ma zhen pa ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas rnam par 'phel lo //
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing chos thams cad la mngon par ma zhen pa ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas rnam par 'phel lo //
translated: Thus, Subhūti, the bodhisattva, the great being, coursing in the perfection of wisdom, not settling down on all dharmas, increases the perfection of giving,

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pas rnam par 'phel lo //🔽bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas rnam par 'phel lo //

translated: increases the perfection of morality,🔽increases the perfection of patience,

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pas rnam par 'phel lo //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pas rnam par 'phel lo //
translated: increases the perfection of vigour,

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pas rnam par 'phel lo //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pas rnam par 'phel lo //
translated: increases the perfection of concentration,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas rnam par 'phel lo //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas rnam par 'phel lo //
translated: and through the perfection of wisdom he will grow.🔽He will enter into the secure stage of a Bodhisattva, and he will not be short of the knowledge of all modes.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par yang dag par 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par yang dag par 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa'o //
translated: He will, coursing in the perfection of wisdom, stand in the signless, the wishless, the unconditioned, and he will not win the fruit of a Streamwinner, etc. to: the enlightenment of a Pratyekabuddha.

original: rab 'byor de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni phyir mi ldog pa'i sa yongs su gnon par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'o //🔽rab 'byor de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni mngon par shes pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed do //

translated: He will, coursing in the perfection of wisdom, stand in the emptiness of the conditioned and the unconditioned, and he will not win the fruit of a Streamwinner, etc. to: the enlightenment of a Pratyekabuddha.🔽He will, coursing in the perfection of wisdom, stand in the emptiness of the nonexistence of own-being, and he will not win the fruit of a Streamwinner, etc. to: the enlightenment of a Pratyekabuddha.🔽He will, coursing in the perfection of wisdom, stand in the emptiness of the nonexistence of own-being, and he will not win the fruit of a Streamwinner, etc. to: the enlightenment of a Pratyekabuddha.🔽He will, coursing in the perfection of wisdom, stand in the emptiness of the nonexistence of own-being, and he will not win the fruit of a Streamwinner, etc. to: the enlightenment of a Pratyekabuddha.🔽He will, coursing in the perfection of wisdom, stand in the emptiness of the nonexistence of own-being, and he will not win the fruit of a Streamwinner, etc. to: the enlightenment of a Pratyekabuddha.🔽He will, coursing in the perfection of wisdom, stand in the emptiness of the nonexistence of own-being, and he will not win the fruit of a Streamwinner, etc. to: the enlightenment of a Pratyekabuddha.🔽He will, coursing in the perfection of wisdom, stand in the emptiness of the nonexistence of own-being, and he will not win the fruit of a Streamwinner, etc. to: the enlightenment of a Pratyekabuddha.🔽He will, coursing in the perfection of wisdom, stand in the emptiness of the nonexistence of own-being, and he will not win the fruit of a Streamwinner, etc. to: the enlightenment of a Pratyekabuddha.

analyzed: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems /

analyzed: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems /

original: 'du byed kyi de bzhin nyid dang / rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid dang / ming dang gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid dang / skye mched drug gi de bzhin nyid dang / reg pa'i de bzhin nyid dang / tshor ba'i de bzhin nyid dang /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi de bzhin nyid dang / rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid dang / ming dang gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid dang / skye mched drug gi de bzhin nyid dang / reg pa'i de bzhin nyid dang / tshor ba'i de bzhin nyid dang /
translated: Or the suchness of formations, the suchness of consciousness, the suchness of name and form, the suchness of the six sense sources, the suchness of contact, the suchness of feeling,

original: sred pa'i de bzhin nyid dang / len pa'i de bzhin nyid dang / srid pa'i de bzhin nyid dang / skye ba'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de bzhin te /
analyzed: sred pa'i de bzhin nyid dang / len pa'i de bzhin nyid dang / srid pa'i de bzhin nyid dang / skye ba'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de bzhin te /
translated: the suchness of craving, the suchness of grasping, the suchness of existence, or the suchness of birth?

original: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems /
translated: What do you think, Subhūti,

original: rga shi'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de byang chub sems dpa' yin pa'am /
analyzed: rga shi'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de byang chub sems dpa' yin pa'am /
translated: is the suchness of aging and death the bodhisattva,

original: rga shi'i de bzhin nyid las gzhan zhig yin pa'am /🔽rga shi'i de bzhin nyid la byang chub sems dpa' yod pa'am /
analyzed: rga shi'i de bzhin nyid las gzhan zhig yin pa'am / rga shi'i de bzhin nyid la byang chub sems dpa' yod pa'am /
translated: or is it other than the suchness of aging and death,🔽or does the suchness of aging and death exist in the bodhisattva,

original: byang chub sems dpa' la rga shi'i de bzhin nyid yod pa'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' la rga shi'i de bzhin nyid yod pa'am /
translated: or does the bodhisattva exist in the suchness of aging and death?

original: rga shi'i de bzhin nyid med pa zhig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
analyzed: rga shi'i de bzhin nyid med pa zhig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /
translated: “What do you think, Subhūti, is the reality of old age and death a bodhisattva?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so //
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so //
translated: “No, Blessed One,” he replied.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems /
translated: “What do you think, Subhūti,

original: gal te rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba so so ba rnams la byang chub sems dpa' med na tshogs pa rnams la yod pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba so so ba rnams la byang chub sems dpa' med na tshogs pa rnams la yod pa yin te /
translated: if a bodhisattva is not in the individual parts of dependent origination, is he in their collection?

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de byang chub sems dpa' yin pa'am /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de byang chub sems dpa' yin pa'am /
translated: Is the reality of dependent origination a bodhisattva?

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i de bzhin nyid las gzhan zhig yin pa'am /🔽rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i de bzhin nyid la byang chub sems dpa' yod pa'am /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i de bzhin nyid las gzhan zhig yin pa'am / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i de bzhin nyid la byang chub sems dpa' yod pa'am /
translated: Or is it something other than the reality of dependent origination?🔽Is a bodhisattva in the reality of dependent origination?

original: byang chub sems dpa' la rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i de bzhin nyid yod pa'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' la rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i de bzhin nyid yod pa'am /
translated: Or is the reality of dependent origination in a bodhisattva?

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i de bzhin nyid med pa zhig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam /🔽gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das @115a * //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i de bzhin nyid med pa zhig byang chub sems dpa' yin snyam mam / gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das @115a * //
translated: “Do you think that the suchness of dependent origination is not a bodhisattva?🔽”

original: de ni ma lags so //
analyzed: de ni ma lags so //
translated: “No, Blessed One.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor khyod kyis don gyi dbang gang zhig mthong nas 'di skad du gzugs byang chub sems dpa' ma yin no //🔽tshor ba ma yin /🔽'du shes ma yin /🔽'du byed rnams ma yin /
analyzed: rab 'byor khyod kyis don gyi dbang gang zhig mthong nas 'di skad du gzugs byang chub sems dpa' ma yin no // tshor ba ma yin / 'du shes ma yin / 'du byed rnams ma yin /
translated: “Su­bhūti, what is the import that you have seen that you have said, ‘Physical forms are not the bodhisattvas,

original: rnam par shes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ma yin no //
translated: and feelings, perceptions, formative predispositions, and consciousness are not the bodhisattvas;

original: mig dang gzugs dang mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams ma yin /
analyzed: mig dang gzugs dang mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams ma yin /
translated: the eyes and physical forms and the sensory element of visual consciousness are not the bodhisattvas;

original: rna ba dang sgra dang / rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'i khams ma yin /🔽sna dang dri dang sna'i rnam par shes pa'i khams ma yin /
analyzed: rna ba dang sgra dang / rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'i khams ma yin / sna dang dri dang sna'i rnam par shes pa'i khams ma yin /
translated: the ears and sounds and the sensory element of auditory consciousness are not the bodhisattvas;🔽the nose and odors and the sensory element of olfactory consciousness are not the bodhisattvas;

original: lce dang / ro dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa'i khams ma yin /
analyzed: lce dang / ro dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa'i khams ma yin /
translated: the tongue and tastes and the sensory element of gustatory consciousness are not the bodhisattvas;

original: lus dang reg bya dang lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams ma yin /
analyzed: lus dang reg bya dang lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams ma yin /
translated: the body and tangible objects and the sensory element of tactile consciousness are not the bodhisattvas;

original: yid dang chos dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams ma yin no //
analyzed: yid dang chos dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams ma yin no //
translated: It is not the mental element, the dharmas, or the mental consciousness element.

original: sa'i khams ma yin /
analyzed: sa'i khams ma yin /
translated: It is not the earth element.

original: chu'i khams ma yin /
analyzed: chu'i khams ma yin /
translated: It is not the water element.

original: me'i khams ma yin /🔽rlung gi khams ma yin /
analyzed: me'i khams ma yin / rlung gi khams ma yin /
translated: It is not the fire element.🔽It is not the wind element.

original: nam mkha'i khams ma yin /
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams ma yin /
translated: It is not the space element.

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams ma yin no //
translated: It is not the consciousness element.

original: mig ma yin /
analyzed: mig ma yin /
translated: It is not the eyes.

original: rna ba ma yin /🔽sna ma yin /
analyzed: rna ba ma yin / sna ma yin /
translated: It is not the ears.🔽It is not the nose.

original: lce ma yin /
analyzed: lce ma yin /
translated: It is not the tongue.

original: lus ma yin /
analyzed: lus ma yin /
translated: It is not the body.

original: yid ma yin /
analyzed: yid ma yin /
translated: It is not the mind.

original: gzugs ma yin /
analyzed: gzugs ma yin /
translated: It is not form.

original: sgra ma yin /🔽dri ma yin /🔽ro ma yin /
analyzed: sgra ma yin / dri ma yin / ro ma yin /
translated: It is not sound.🔽It is not smell.🔽It is not taste.

original: reg bya ma yin /
analyzed: reg bya ma yin /
translated: It is not texture.

original: chos ma yin no //
analyzed: chos ma yin no //
translated: It is not dharmas.

original: ma rig pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ma rig pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not ignorance.

original: de bzhin du 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dang / skye ba dang / rga shi rnams byang chub sems dpa' ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dang / skye ba dang / rga shi rnams byang chub sems dpa' ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, it is not volitional factors, consciousness, name and form, the six sense sources, contact, feeling, craving, appropriation, existence, birth, or old age and death.

original: gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid byang chub sems dpa' ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid byang chub sems dpa' ma yin te /
translated: The suchness of form is not the bodhisattva.

original: tshor ba'i de bzhin nyid ma yin /
analyzed: tshor ba'i de bzhin nyid ma yin /
translated: It is not the suchness of feeling.

original: 'du shes kyi de bzhin nyid ma yin /
analyzed: 'du shes kyi de bzhin nyid ma yin /
translated: It is not the suchness of perception.

original: 'du byed rnams kyi de bzhin nyid ma yin /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams kyi de bzhin nyid ma yin /
translated: It is not the suchness of formation.

original: rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid byang chub sems dpa' ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid byang chub sems dpa' ma yin no //
translated: It is not the suchness of consciousness that is a bodhisattva.

original: mig dang gzugs dang mig gi rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: mig dang gzugs dang mig gi rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid ma yin te /
translated: It is not the suchness of the eye, form, or eye consciousness.

original: rna ba dang sgra dang / rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid ma yin /🔽sna dang dri dang sna'i rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid ma yin /
analyzed: rna ba dang sgra dang / rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid ma yin / sna dang dri dang sna'i rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid ma yin /
translated: It is not the suchness of the ear, sound, or ear consciousness.🔽It is not the suchness of the nose, smell, or nose consciousness.

original: lce dang ro dang lce'i rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid ma yin /
analyzed: lce dang ro dang lce'i rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid ma yin /
translated: It is not the suchness of the tongue, taste, or tongue consciousness.

original: lus dang reg bya dang lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid ma yin /
analyzed: lus dang reg bya dang lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid ma yin /
translated: It is not the suchness of the body, touch, or body consciousness.

original: yid dang chos dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: yid dang chos dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid ma yin no //
translated: It is not the suchness of the mind, mental phenomena, or mind consciousness.

original: sa'i khams kyi de @115b bzhin nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: sa'i khams kyi de @115b bzhin nyid ma yin te /
translated: It is not the suchness of the earth element.

original: chu'i khams kyi de bzhin nyid ma yin /
analyzed: chu'i khams kyi de bzhin nyid ma yin /
translated: It is not the suchness of the water element.

original: me'i khams kyi de bzhin nyid ma yin /🔽rlung gi khams kyi de bzhin nyid ma yin /
analyzed: me'i khams kyi de bzhin nyid ma yin / rlung gi khams kyi de bzhin nyid ma yin /
translated: It is not the suchness of the fire element.🔽It is not the suchness of the wind element.

original: nam mkha'i khams kyi de bzhin nyid ma yin /
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams kyi de bzhin nyid ma yin /
translated: It is not the suchness of the space element.

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi de bzhin nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi de bzhin nyid ma yin no //
translated: It is not the suchness of the consciousness element.

original: mig gi de bzhin nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: mig gi de bzhin nyid ma yin te /
translated: It is not the suchness of the eye.

original: rna ba'i de bzhin nyid ma yin /🔽sna'i de bzhin nyid ma yin /
analyzed: rna ba'i de bzhin nyid ma yin / sna'i de bzhin nyid ma yin /
translated: It is not the suchness of the ear.🔽It is not the suchness of the nose.

original: lce'i de bzhin nyid ma yin /
analyzed: lce'i de bzhin nyid ma yin /
translated: It is not the suchness of the tongue.

original: lus kyi de bzhin nyid ma yin /
analyzed: lus kyi de bzhin nyid ma yin /
translated: It is not the suchness of the body.

original: yid kyi de bzhin nyid ma yin /
analyzed: yid kyi de bzhin nyid ma yin /
translated: It is not the suchness of the mind.

original: gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid ma yin /
analyzed: gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid ma yin /
translated: It is not the suchness of a form.

original: sgra'i de bzhin nyid ma yin /🔽dri'i de bzhin nyid ma yin /
analyzed: sgra'i de bzhin nyid ma yin / dri'i de bzhin nyid ma yin /
translated: It is not the suchness of a sound.🔽It is not the suchness of a smell.

original: ro'i de bzhin nyid ma yin /
analyzed: ro'i de bzhin nyid ma yin /
translated: It is not the suchness of a taste.

original: reg bya'i de bzhin nyid ma yin /
analyzed: reg bya'i de bzhin nyid ma yin /
translated: It is not the suchness of a tangible object.

original: chos kyi de bzhin nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi de bzhin nyid ma yin no //
translated: It is not the suchness of a dharma.

original: ma rig pa'i de bzhin nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i de bzhin nyid ma yin te /
translated: It is not the suchness of ignorance.

original: 'du byed kyi de bzhin nyid ma yin /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi de bzhin nyid ma yin /
translated: It is not the suchness of volitional factors.

original: rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid ma yin /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid ma yin /
translated: It is not the suchness of consciousness.

original: ming dang gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid ma yin /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid ma yin /
translated: It is not the suchness of name and form.

original: skye mched drug gi de bzhin nyid ma yin /
analyzed: skye mched drug gi de bzhin nyid ma yin /
translated: It is not the suchness of the six sense fields.

original: reg pa'i de bzhin nyid ma yin /
analyzed: reg pa'i de bzhin nyid ma yin /
translated: It is not the suchness of contact.

original: tshor ba'i de bzhin nyid ma yin /
analyzed: tshor ba'i de bzhin nyid ma yin /
translated: It is not the suchness of feeling.

original: sred pa'i de bzhin nyid ma yin /
analyzed: sred pa'i de bzhin nyid ma yin /
translated: It is not the suchness of craving.

original: len pa'i de bzhin nyid ma yin /
analyzed: len pa'i de bzhin nyid ma yin /
translated: It is not the suchness of grasping.

original: srid pa'i de bzhin nyid ma yin /
analyzed: srid pa'i de bzhin nyid ma yin /
translated: It is not the suchness of existence.

original: skye ba'i de bzhin nyid ma yin /
analyzed: skye ba'i de bzhin nyid ma yin /
translated: It is not the suchness of birth.

original: rga shi'i de bzhin nyid ma yin pa nas /
analyzed: rga shi'i de bzhin nyid ma yin pa nas /
translated: It is not the suchness of aging and death,

original: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i de bzhin nyid byang chub sems dpa' ma yin no /🔽// / bam po brgyad pa /
analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i de bzhin nyid byang chub sems dpa' ma yin no / // / bam po brgyad pa /
translated: and so on up to: it is not the suchness of the aggregates, elements, sense fields, and dependent origination.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' shin tu ma mchis shing mi dmigs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' shin tu ma mchis shing mi dmigs te /
translated: “Blessed One, bodhisattvas do not exist and are not found.

original: des na gzugs byang chub sems dpar 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis /
analyzed: des na gzugs byang chub sems dpar 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis /
translated: So how could form be a bodhisattva?

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa byang chub sems dpar 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa byang chub sems dpar 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis /
translated: How could feeling, perception, formation, or consciousness be a bodhisattva?

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' shin tu ma mchis shing mi dmigs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' shin tu ma mchis shing mi dmigs te /
translated: Blessed One, bodhisattvas do not exist and are not found.

original: des na mig dang gzugs dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa rnams byang chub sems dpar 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis /
analyzed: des na mig dang gzugs dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa rnams byang chub sems dpar 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis /
translated: Therefore, how could eyes, forms, and eye consciousness be bodhisattvas?

original: de bzhin du rna ba dang / sgra dang rna ba'i rnam par shes pa rnams dang / sna dang / dri dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa rnams dang / lce dang ro dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa rnams dang / lus dang reg bya dang lus kyi rnam par shes pa rnams dang /🔽yid dang chos dang yid @116a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba dang / sgra dang rna ba'i rnam par shes pa rnams dang / sna dang / dri dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa rnams dang / lce dang ro dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa rnams dang / lus dang reg bya dang lus kyi rnam par shes pa rnams dang / yid dang chos dang yid @116a * //
translated: Similarly, how could ears, sounds, and ear consciousness; noses, smells, and nose consciousness; tongues, tastes, and tongue consciousness; bodies, textures, and body consciousness;

original: kyi rnam par shes pa rnams byang chub sems dpar 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis /
analyzed: kyi rnam par shes pa rnams byang chub sems dpar 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis /
translated: and minds, mental phenomena, and mind consciousness be bodhisattvas?

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' shin tu ma mchis shing mi dmigs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' shin tu ma mchis shing mi dmigs te /
translated: Blessed One, bodhisattvas do not exist and are not found.

original: des na sa'i khams byang chub sems dpar 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis /
analyzed: des na sa'i khams byang chub sems dpar 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis /
translated: Therefore, how could the earth element be a bodhisattva?

original: de bzhin du chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams byang chub sems dpar 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis /
analyzed: de bzhin du chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams byang chub sems dpar 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis /
translated: Likewise, how could the water element, the fire element, the wind element, the space element, and the consciousness element be a bodhisattva?

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' shin tu ma mchis shing mi dmigs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' shin tu ma mchis shing mi dmigs te /
translated: Blessed One, a bodhisattva is utterly nonexistent and not apprehended.

original: des na mig byang chub sems dpar 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis /
analyzed: des na mig byang chub sems dpar 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis /
translated: Therefore, how could the eyes be a bodhisattva?

original: de bzhin du rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid byang chub sems dpar 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis /
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid byang chub sems dpar 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis /
translated: Likewise, how could the ears, nose, tongue, body, and mind be a bodhisattva?

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' shin tu ma mchis shing mi dmigs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' shin tu ma mchis shing mi dmigs te /
translated: Blessed One, a bodhisattva is utterly nonexistent and not apprehended.

original: des na gzugs byang chub sems dpar 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis /
analyzed: des na gzugs byang chub sems dpar 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis /
translated: Therefore, how could form be a bodhisattva?

original: de bzhin du sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang chos byang chub sems dpar 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis /
analyzed: de bzhin du sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang chos byang chub sems dpar 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis /
translated: Likewise, how could sound, smell, taste, texture, and mental objects be a bodhisattva?

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' shin tu ma mchis shing mi dmigs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' shin tu ma mchis shing mi dmigs te /
translated: Blessed One, bodhisattvas do not exist and are not found.

original: des na ma rig pa byang chub sems dpar 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis /
analyzed: des na ma rig pa byang chub sems dpar 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis /
translated: So how could ignorance be a bodhisattva?

original: de bzhin du 'du byed rnams dang rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dang / skye ba dang / rga shi byang chub sems dpar 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'du byed rnams dang rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dang / skye ba dang / rga shi byang chub sems dpar 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis /
translated: Similarly, how could the formative mental factors, consciousness, name and form, the six sense sources, contact, feeling, craving, grasping, becoming, birth, and aging and death be bodhisattvas?

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' shin tu ma mchis shing mi dmigs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' shin tu ma mchis shing mi dmigs te /
translated: Blessed One, bodhisattvas do not exist and are not found.

original: des na gzugs 'di'i de bzhin nyid dmigs par lta yang ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: des na gzugs 'di'i de bzhin nyid dmigs par lta yang ga la 'gyur /
translated: So how could the suchness of this form be apprehended?

original: de bzhin du tshor ba'i de bzhin nyid dang / 'du shes kyi de bzhin nyid dang / 'du byed rnams kyi de bzhin nyid dang / rnam par shes pa 'di'i de bzhin nyid dmigs par lta yang ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba'i de bzhin nyid dang / 'du shes kyi de bzhin nyid dang / 'du byed rnams kyi de bzhin nyid dang / rnam par shes pa 'di'i de bzhin nyid dmigs par lta yang ga la 'gyur /
translated: Similarly, how could the suchness of this feeling, the suchness of this perception, the suchness of these formative factors, and the suchness of this consciousness be apprehended?

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' shin tu ma mchis shing mi dmigs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' shin tu ma mchis shing mi dmigs te /
translated: Blessed One, bodhisattvas are utterly nonexistent and non-apprehensible.🔽Therefore, how could the suchness of the eyes, forms, and eye consciousness,

original: des na mig dang gzugs dang mig gi rnam par shes pa rnams dang / rna ba dang / sgra dang / rna ba'i rnam par shes pa rnams dang / sna dang dri dang sna'i rnam par @116b shes pa rnams dang / lce dang ro dang lce'i rnam par shes pa rnams dang /
analyzed: des na mig dang gzugs dang mig gi rnam par shes pa rnams dang / rna ba dang / sgra dang / rna ba'i rnam par shes pa rnams dang / sna dang dri dang sna'i rnam par @116b shes pa rnams dang / lce dang ro dang lce'i rnam par shes pa rnams dang /
translated: the ears, sounds, and ear consciousness, the nose, smells, and nose consciousness, the tongue, tastes, and tongue consciousness,

original: lus dang reg bya dang lus kyi rnam par shes pa rnams dang / yid dang chos dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa rnams 'di'i de bzhin nyid dmigs par lta yang ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: lus dang reg bya dang lus kyi rnam par shes pa rnams dang / yid dang chos dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa rnams 'di'i de bzhin nyid dmigs par lta yang ga la 'gyur /
translated: the body, textures, and body consciousness, and the mind, mental phenomena, and mind consciousness be apprehended?

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' shin tu ma mchis shing mi dmigs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' shin tu ma mchis shing mi dmigs te /
translated: Blessed One, bodhisattvas are utterly nonexistent and non-apprehensible.

original: des na sa'i khams 'di'i de bzhin nyid dmigs par lta yang ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: des na sa'i khams 'di'i de bzhin nyid dmigs par lta yang ga la 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, how could the suchness of the earth element be apprehended?

original: de bzhin du chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di'i de bzhin nyid dmigs par lta yang ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: de bzhin du chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di'i de bzhin nyid dmigs par lta yang ga la 'gyur /
translated: Likewise, how could the suchness of the water element, the fire element, the wind element, the space element, and the consciousness element be apprehended?

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' shin tu ma mchis shing mi dmigs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' shin tu ma mchis shing mi dmigs te /
translated: Blessed One, a bodhisattva is utterly nonexistent and not apprehended.

original: des na mig gi de bzhin nyid dmigs par lta yang ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: des na mig gi de bzhin nyid dmigs par lta yang ga la 'gyur /
translated: How could the suchness of the eyes be apprehended?

original: de bzhin du rna ba'i de bzhin nyid dang / sna'i de bzhin nyid dang / lce'i de bzhin nyid dang / lus kyi de bzhin nyid dang / yid kyi de bzhin nyid dmigs par lta yang ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba'i de bzhin nyid dang / sna'i de bzhin nyid dang / lce'i de bzhin nyid dang / lus kyi de bzhin nyid dang / yid kyi de bzhin nyid dmigs par lta yang ga la 'gyur /
translated: Likewise, how could the suchness of the ears, the nose, the tongue, the body, and the mind be apprehended?

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' shin tu ma mchis shing mi dmigs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' shin tu ma mchis shing mi dmigs te /
translated: Blessed One, a bodhisattva is utterly nonexistent and not apprehended.

original: des na gzugs 'di'i de bzhin nyid dmigs par lta yang ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: des na gzugs 'di'i de bzhin nyid dmigs par lta yang ga la 'gyur /

analyzed: de bzhin du sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg dang / chos 'di'i de bzhin nyid dmigs par 'gyur ba lta ga la yod /
translated: Similarly, how could the suchness of sound, smell, taste, texture, and mental objects be apprehended?

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' shin tu ma mchis shing mi dmigs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' shin tu ma mchis shing mi dmigs te /

analyzed: des na ma rig pa 'di'i de bzhin nyid dmigs par lta ga la 'gyur /

original: de bzhin du 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang / gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dang / skye ba dang / rga shi 'di'i de bzhin nyid dmigs par lta yang ga la 'gyur /

translated: Similarly, how could the suchness of formations, consciousness, name and form, the six sense sources, contact, feeling, craving, grasping, becoming, birth, and aging and death be apprehended?

original: bcom ldan 'das de ltar phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba so so re re ba rnams dang / bsdus pa rnams la byang chub sems dpa' shin tu ma mchis shing mi dmigs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ltar phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba so so re re ba rnams dang / bsdus pa rnams la byang chub sems dpa' shin tu ma mchis shing mi dmigs te /
translated: Blessed One, in this way, the individual and collective aggregates, elements, sense sources, and dependent origination are utterly nonexistent and unobservable.

original: des na phung po dang / khams dang skye mched 'di'i de bzhin nyid dmigs par lta ga la 'gyur te de ni gnas ma mchis so //
analyzed: des na phung po dang / khams dang skye mched 'di'i de bzhin nyid dmigs par lta ga la 'gyur te de ni gnas ma mchis so //
translated: How could the suchness of these aggregates, elements, and sense-fields be an object? It is not tenable.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
